website_summaries.verdict: Precision-cut ports line the base of this colander, keeping water from collecting in the bottom.
pros: Holes are small enough to drain cooked rice and quinoa as well as larger items
Use to rinse, sieve, cook, and steam
Solid base with precision-cut drainage ports
Made of rust-proof, dishwasher safe 18/10 stainless steel
Smooth on the inside and outside

customer_reviews.title: Very Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased 2 LiveFresh 5 QT Steel Colanders. The reviews were good and they were accurate. The stainless steel seems very sturdy. The handles are attached with some kind of grommets, not just welded. The bottom is firmly attached. There are also two holes in the bottom for drainage. I'm very pleased with the materials and construction and look forward to using them.
customer_reviews.author: lunarchi

customer_reviews.title: Almost Ideal
customer_reviews.text: This colander replaces an older and long-lived Farberware stainless unit which replaced older aluminum and enamel shorter-lived units. The new one is well executed, one indication being the shot-welding that joins the base to the basket. Stainless is burn-prone, but the welds showed no hint of burns, so both production and pre-shipping inspection are solid on this matter. Why not a fifth star? The edges of the handles were a bit sharp, not cut-hazard sharp, but less than ideally comfortable. I'll acclimate, and they'll smooth over time, but attention to that detail in speccing, production, and/or inspection would have gotten a fifth star. Yes, I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: jaymac

customer_reviews.title: The Bowl's extra 20% in Material Makes a difference.
customer_reviews.text: Don't look any further, this is the one. What a difference the 20% thicker stainless steel makes. This colander feels sturdy, the perforations are clean, not sharp. This is in comparison to another 5 star colander I ordered and received damaged. The other product was flimsy and it's perforations were sharp. I returned it, and went back to search for other well rated products. I found this one. There is no comparison to quality. The thicker material and clean perforations are worth the few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Rust
customer_reviews.text: The colander began to rust after 4 months of very minimal use.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Buy once cry once! Get the good stuff now and skip the cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought one of these, back when I first purchased a colander at a local grocery store. That one seemed to always retain water no matter how much I'd shake it or wait. Finally tired of poor performance I found this one, and it is a real gem. In addition to the small holes all over the place and the comfortable handles, this LiveFresh one has holes in the base to help with the initial runoff. A nice touch. It's well finished with no rough spots or sharp edges, and feels like it'll last a lifetime. I have run some Ditalini and some Angel Hair pastas though this one and they both drained great! Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: D L

customer_reviews.title: Just click to buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! The quality of its craftsmanship is superior. It is a perfect large size. It stores beautifully on my cabinet door for easy access. The handles are fabulous. It has an indent where you thumb goes for sturdy holding. AND the best part... there are tons of holes for the water to drain. I use this everyday and want to buy other sizes from this same company.
customer_reviews.author: mamaDJ

customer_reviews.title: thoughtful design and quality construction
customer_reviews.text: "This colander has it all. Drains super fast, is easy to handle and drainage holes interior and exterior are smooth so no snags on the dishtowel. No back up while draining since base keeps bottom of colander elevated and has its own drainage holes to facilitate liquid moving out and away from food. Large comfortable handles so I can get a really good grip even with a potholder and still have enough grip to move colander with one hand if needed. Sturdy and well made but lightweight and can place on my new counter without worry of scratching. Love it!"
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap not worth what I paid. Found the same strainer for a dollar. At the dollar general store
customer_reviews.author: Bill Johnson

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this colander several months ago and use it regularly. It’s the best colander I’ve ever used. The micro perforations keeps the thinnest noodles from slipping through and makes it drain really fast. The drainage holes do not get clogged like other colanders I’ve used, so it’s easy to clean. It’s sturdy and smooth all over. A high quality product. I’d purchase from LiveFresh again.
customer_reviews.author: M - HI

customer_reviews.title: Well made - glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a colander with a base so my food wouldn't touch the sink, so I picked this one. I'm glad I did. It's silly to write a glowing review about something as mundane as a colander, but after shopping in stores for the 'right' colander, this one blows away the competition and is reasonably priced. It is well made with strong handles, a smooth interior, and holes small enough for food to stay in. Even my husband noticed how the spaghetti didn't get caught, so that tells you something. Bye-bye to my old plastic colander and metal one that sat right on the sink (I never liked that).
customer_reviews.author: KristieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A large easy to clean colander
customer_reviews.text: I really like colander , I have a few in different sizes but this one is my favorite! First of all it’s large enough for a full family’s main entree of pasta and it fits perfectly over my sink with the handles resting on the edges keeping it from sitting in the sink so that it drains perfectly and from there it goes straight into the dishwasher!
customer_reviews.author: Msb60

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this strainer is very good and I really like how small the holes are so I don't lose part of my food through the holes. But it's fairly large and doesn't fit on the top rack of my dishwasher, so I either have to use up valuable pot and pan space or wash it by hand - then the little holes are hard to clean. Still like the strainer a lot - just wish it were just a tad smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for quinoa
customer_reviews.text: I bought this strainer because the description said it would work with quinoa. I watched a pound of quinoa pour right through the holes onto the table. So do not buy this if you want to rinse quinoa in it. Other than that it would work fine for pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole B.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect....but not for rice
customer_reviews.text: I should’ve looked at the description better. I just saw rice and thought this would work. I received it and needed to rinse rice. I use Kokomo Rose (California sushi rice) and it just goes through the holes. As I re-read the description, it says “cooked rice” which is much larger in diameter than uncooked rice. Shame on me. Other than that, it looks like it would be great for anything larger. It feels durable. I didn’t want to get two colanders, but looks like now I’ll have to!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: They say you get what you pay for, well at times its true. This is amazing, For the people that say they are using it to strain rice, (get a rice cooker, NO straining required) If you use it for what it's intended for then you're going to love this Colander. How the handles are attached is top notch. Pay the couple of $$ more and buy this colander, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have been replacing everything in my kitchen to glass and stainless and stumbled upon America’s Test Kitchen’s review on this colander and decided to give it a shot. The straining holes are the size of like a mesh so you don’t lose thin noodles through them, but thick steel it doesn’t bend or feel cheap. Add in the fact it was half the cost of the one I originally was going to get and this was a slam dunk of a purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nye

customer_reviews.title: It's time to upgrade Grandma's most prize possession
customer_reviews.text: It was seriously time to retire the version that I've used since the beginning of time. I know you know the one to which I'm referring, dented aluminum with big perfs. I'd add a picture but the embarrassment is too much. I'm not sure why it took me so long but I found this one which was half the price of the retail store (red dot with circles). Vastly superior, I highly recommend the upgrade to "Grandma's first colandar."
customer_reviews.author: The Nutty Professor

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a solid heavy duty colander. Quite large though if you have limited storage. My biggest complaints are that it is tough to clean, and can sometimes have a cheese grater affect on well done pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall great - doesn't splash hot water!
customer_reviews.text: This strainer so far is great for us, it doesn't let any pasta through because of the small holes, despite being very light it feels very sturdy, and I am no longer getting splashed by hot water like with my previous strainer! We typically clean or at least rinse this right after using it, so it has been easy to clean. I suspect due to the tight corners where the bottom meets the dish portion, it would be difficult to clean if you left residue to dry but we are not going to be testing that. I definitely recommend this strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Karls

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after we saw Chef Gordon Ramsey rinsing Jasmine rice. Always looking for ways to reduce starches etc., and though we would try this as well. Problem was, we had 2 plastic colanders that were just OK for rinsing pasta but would not make it to rinse rice. This arrived quickly (thank you Amazon Prime) and it is very well made and really, REAllY nice!! It is so nice, that without even trying it out yet, I got rid of my 2 plastic ones!! No matter what, this is an awesome addition to my kitchen supplies!
customer_reviews.author: Us

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not suitable for washing rice.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for everything else but I noticed a good amount of rice goes through the holes. I assumed the micro holes would not let as many through but enough get through that I feel people should be aware of it
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Great design helps salad greens air dry quicker
customer_reviews.text: I use this to drain salad greens after washing and spinning in a salad spinner. The design helps them to drain and air dry quicker because it's wide and is covered with holes. I just let the greens sit a while, stirring them every so often. It works great, and saves me a lot of time compared to my old method of laying the greens out on baking sheets to air dry! The colander seems to be high quality and is very easy to clean. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is just eh type of functional and beautiful piece of working stainless steel that you need in your kitchen. I had one from the beginning of my marriage and I needed a smaller holed one because of grains and lentils that slipped through the other one. This is really a work of art! The company is responsive and crafted this with great care. They even sent me a cleaning tool as a thank you! I'd say that everyone needs this for their functional and beautiful kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Professional Quality Large Capacity Colander
customer_reviews.text: My two favorite things about this colander are it's little stand at the bottom so I can just stand it in the sink and dump all my spaghetti pot contents and water right into it. The little stand keeps it securely upright and lets all the liquid drain out of both the sides and the bottom. Excellent complete drainage. And, of course, my second favorite thing is that I can just put it in the dishwasher after and have it come out nice and clean with no effort and no starch remaining on the colander or in the little holes.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieB

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: In my search for a new colander, I decided to buy this one for its durability, size, and appealing design. My item arrived on time and as expected. Very pleased with the product, especially with the riveted handles. On a side note, I would have preferred the colander in a box rather than a plastic bag to protect it during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Shagun B

customer_reviews.title: looks good, functions well, durable despite being lighter weight
customer_reviews.text: I’m the guy that buys nicer kitchen tools from William Sonoma for durability, quality, and aesthetic. But when I saw this and its good reviews, I decided to try. It actually is very durable, although the stainless steel “feels” lightweight/thin. It’s a good size for the dishwasher and for your cupboard, but also functions well as a small-holed strainer/colander. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to wash veggies and strain pasta after cooking. So far, it seems very sturdy. It's a great size - I can easily wash 2 lb of baby carrots and it takes up about 1/2 of the bowl. Learned my lesson with cleaning though - the small drain holes picked up fuzz from the scrubby side of my sponge, then transferred it to the food I put in there next. Operator error clearly, but something to be aware of. Good product, good value.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Collander sets new standard.
customer_reviews.text: The LiveFresh with the micro circular perforations, drains your pasta or veggies without any escape of food material. Much easier to clean after use. Much better than a screen mesh colander which can chew up your pasta or veggies, and is hard to wash after use. The Heavy duty handles are larger than normal for great and sure grip. The larger circular base provides no tilt or spillage accidents in the kitchen when performing your culinary duties.
customer_reviews.author: dave5238

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with my purchase of the LiveFresh stainless steel strainer
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase of the LiveFresh stainless steel strainer. I went with this strainer because the handles are riveted in place. After comparing this to others that are similar that was definately one of the deciding factors. It arrived beautifully and in perfect condition. I truly believe I will never have to purchase another strainer again. This is quality!
customer_reviews.author: Crazed One In The Burg

customer_reviews.title: PLEASANTLY SURPRISED
customer_reviews.text: Upon looking at the colander's perforation on the Amazon web page, I expected the product would not be sturdy, but surprise, surprise, surprise!. I put in the dishwasher for a good scrub and sanitizing, and used it right away. It does not bend nor wiggle or bow. nothing gets thru it but liquid, and is good looking too. Let me tell you, this colander is the newest gunslinger in my kitchen arsenal. MJ
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made colander
customer_reviews.text: ReAlly well made colander. I wish they also offered a 3 quart version. It’s BIG. Nice workmanship, The handles feel very sturdy. There are a LOT of small holes (so rice or quinoa won’t slip out), and there is no roughness at the holes. The holes aren’t just punched out; they feel polished.
customer_reviews.author: Country Doc

customer_reviews.title: VERY well made
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much a repeat of what everyone else says: We love that the handles are riveted on and the holes in the base that prevent back flow when set in the sink. Solid and well made, we anticipate this holding up very well over the years to come! The only minor tweak we would make it to eliminate the tiny rim around the foot of the base as it holds water there and dribbles when you pick it up. Otherwise it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Bernier

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been slowly taking out all the plastic stuff in my kitchen and replacing them with Stainless steel items and this colander is what I've been looking for! I'm so happy I ordered it. It's heavy weight and I love that it has tiny holes.... every time I went looking for one, they all had large holes..... not this one... everything strains through it perfectly and it's easy to clean too....
customer_reviews.author: T. A. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Quality materials, superb function, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I was leary about this item in the beginning so I’ve waited to leave review. I was worried about cleaning it with the “cheese grater texture” but a brush takes care of it easily. It’s been used for months now and holding up well. It drains super quick and thorough compared to my old plastic one. It’s been left sitting in a pot with water accidentally and has not rusted.
customer_reviews.author: Twin Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice colander, but handles have sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: The colander works well and I'm very happy with it overall. My only concern is that the handles have sharp edges, almost as though the manufacturing process was not completed. I'm careful with it so haven't had a problem, yet...
customer_reviews.author: JNell

customer_reviews.title: Very nice colander, that is doing dual duty at my ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice colander, that is doing dual duty at my house. I've used it both as a colander and as a fruit bowl. It drains food fast with no residual pockets of water. It's working well as a fruit bowl, too. The micro perforations all over allow good airflow for fruit, and the shape is pleasing enough for it to look nice on the kitchen table or counter. I took a long time picking a colander, and I'm glad I got this one.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Stanley

customer_reviews.title: This strainer I like very much holes through out the entire bowl
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would be giving a review on a colander. Not all strainers are created equal. I currently have a steel strainer that does not have holes through out the entire bowl. The liquid pools in the bottom of my current strainer. Not enough holes in the bottom. I didn't think about that when I purchased it. This strainer I like very much holes through out the entire bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Joe garica

customer_reviews.title: A Super Colander!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely PERFECT! I've never spent so much money on a colander, but so far, I just LOVE this one! And it looks so beautiful that I've hung it up on my kitchen wall, where everything is super-shiny and extremely contemporary in appearance. I haven't had it long enough to see if it's going to rust, mind you, but otherwise, the design of it and the strainability, etc., is just terrific. BECAUSE of just how great it is, I've gone ahead and ordered the over-the-counter strainer, as well. Talk about blind faith, huh?!?!?
customer_reviews.author: Susie V Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: 4 years later and still looks new...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in ‘17 and it gets used multiple times weekly. This colander stands up to the abuse. Rugged and well made. Looks new still. Note- We hand wash, never put it in the dishwasher so I can’t speak to that.
customer_reviews.author: RBnVA

customer_reviews.title: Not great for rice
customer_reviews.text: This is nice but if you measure your rice (I did not) you would know that some of it is less than 1.8mm so maybe 25% of it washes right through the holes. Nice quality and works great for past and stuff.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I break cheap stuff but not this.
customer_reviews.text: I used my wife’s colander and broke it trying to shake the lettuce out. I can be rough with everything she said you broke this I was in trouble. I try to buy the best after I break cheap stuff well this is super strong. Not even I will break this thing. It’s Rob proof...buy it super thick metal. I grow my own vegetables and will have this my whole life.
customer_reviews.author: Rob coker

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been great from the start! Wr use it all the time and it always comes clean so quickly. It's pretty big too so that's even better! We have a small sink and it fits perfectly fine so definitely recommend this for anyone
customer_reviews.author: ton.tonic

customer_reviews.title: Not a quinoa strainer
customer_reviews.text: This is advertises the ability to rinse quinoa, but it is in no way a quinoa strainer. The holes are too big, it's not even close.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a plastic one for about 20 years for daily use and decided it was probabaly leaching toxins into food by now though it still looks pretty new. I chose this one because of all the tiny holes for easy draining. I am delighted with it. Its light weight and very pretty. I have many enamaled ones of various colors and sizes but they are hard to use. Heavy and not enough holes. Very happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this colander. I have always owned the plastic kind and I am now kicking myself for not upgrading sooner. I love that the strainer holes are evenly throughout and that it has a base. Drains quickly and efficiently! Would definitely recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Honeypot

customer_reviews.title: holes too big to strain quinoa
customer_reviews.text: The product description for this colander included rinsing quinoa, but unfortunately the holes are too big and the quinoa grains fall right through. Very disappointing! I probably won't shop through this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Clayperson13

customer_reviews.title: Good colander
customer_reviews.text: This stainless colander has performed well the handful of times we've used it. Spaghetti, rotini, penne, fruits and vegetables no problem. Thin spaghetti tends to slip through a little. I have no experience with small grains. Cleans up well by hand or dishwasher. Recommendation for the manufacturer to improve this colander by smoothing the handle edge a bit. They have a hard edge. With a couple pounds of food in this colander, the handles can dig into your palm or fingers.
customer_reviews.author: EEMIII

customer_reviews.title: The most important thing I've bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This colander has changed my life. My grapes are washed clean by the water and amazingly, water comes out through these tiny holes. Before I would submerge the grapes in a bowl of water, but the grapes said this was torture and did not like sitting in their own filth. Now the grapes smile and say thank you for a shower instead of a bath.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not made correctly. Wobbles.
customer_reviews.text: There were ripples in the top most part where they pressed it into shape. The ripples caused the base to be crooked and the whole thing wobbles. On top of that the handles are not comfortable and are actually a bit sharp. Made in China. Not the quality I was expecting for the price. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a non-plastic colander, this seemed popular so gave it a try. Was impressed with the quality, came perfect. No dings, odd scuff marks, nothing. I have used it a couple of times so far and it has performed quite well. Was not totally sold on the riveted handles, but damn it feels sturdy. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love my new colander!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ! I love that it has a ton of holes. My old one only had holes in some sort of star pattern, which didn't drain near as well as this one does. It's pretty big, so depending on your needs, that can be either a good thing or a bad thing. Lastly, it looks just like the colander that they use on America's Test Kitchen, and you know they only use the good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Mom To Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Good colander
customer_reviews.text: Very useful colander. I have been using an old plastic Tupperware colander that only had holes on the bottom. This is a much better colander with many perforations along the sides and bottom. I like that it has a stand on the bottom and handles on the sides. I can balance it on the sides of my sink and it doesn't fall into the sink like the plastic one did. It also strains water from the noodles much quicker than the other one did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Finally Bought A Colanders After 28 Years Without One
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever tried draining water from a pot without using a Colanders??? Well it goes something like this....You take the cover for the pot (Lid), put the lid on the pot, leaving it partially eskew, so that a small amount of water is drained when tilting the pot sideways, making sure no food escapes through the hole created from the lid eskewed from the pot...hahaha.... I did that for 28 years living without a Colander....in fact I did not even know the proper name of the device called Colander until recently.... I had been calling it a food drainer....hahahaha
customer_reviews.author: Shane Dean Hofmeister

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel Colander
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in exchange for a 12-quart spaghetti pot we bought that was just too huge for our needs. This colander fits our needs very well although I thought it the finish would be a little nicer than it was. It will suffice to strain/drain the hot water from cooking spaghetti.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Tulsa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Colander!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Its sturdy and pretty good size ...perfect for my needs. I bought it as this was the only one i found with riveted handles instead of the welded ones that come of sooner or later. This colander is not like the other flimsy mesh ones that rust or tears easily. It came with a life time warranty which just requires you to register the product on their website. So far am really happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: aleena

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made product. You can feel the lack of quality in your hand. Major annoyance is the sharp edges everywhere - even all the little holes are sharp. This not only lends to the cheap feel, but also grabs everything which makes it difficult to clean. Regrettable purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen V. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to use and clean colander. Drains quickly thanks to design
customer_reviews.text: A great light-weight colander that after a month or so of use doesn't rust and drains quickly. I expected it to be a little larger. But it's fine for initially washing vegetables, berries and other items. Initially, it seemed a little flimsy. But it's just light weight. The main reason I bought it is the designer included holes in the base of the colander to increase drainage time. There were a number of similar models I considered as well, but those didn't have the two holes in the base.
customer_reviews.author: PatrickO

customer_reviews.title: A valuable tool for draining and rinsing.  The water pours right off.
customer_reviews.text: Drained the cooked pasta very quickly and I found when I cleaned up later that cleaning it was easy. It was very stable with no wobbling when I dumped the pasta in to drain. "Great Service! I really appreciate the follow-up from them to find out if I received the product and that everything was correct. It was! The Colander was just what I wanted and the price was good."
customer_reviews.author: Mystery fan

customer_reviews.title: Need a smaller one too!
customer_reviews.text: Lovely, easy-to-use colander. It would be so nice if they also made a smaller version for small jobs; I’d buy it in a flash! This colander has a really sturdy base.
customer_reviews.author: DP ~ The Uncontrollable Spender!

customer_reviews.title: Best colander for pasta and almost anything
customer_reviews.text: Very useful and one of the best colanders I've ever used. The only minor complaint is that when I wash and leave it inverted to dry, a small amount of water that is trapped within the rolled edge of the top, drips out when it's picked up and place on its pedestal.
customer_reviews.author: SarahCat

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replacement For My Old Colanders!
customer_reviews.text: The 5-quart LiveFresh Stainless Steel Micro-perforated Colander is the perfect replacement for my old plastic and aluminum colanders. As more and more evidence points to the possibility of leaching associated with my old colanders, it gives me peace of mind to be using a high quality stainless model now. I really like that the micro-perfing covers the entire body of the colander, and not just around the bottom, so liquids can escape from everywhere. It is also a solid piece of equipment. What else can I say? I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Hornbeck

customer_reviews.title: very high quality
customer_reviews.text: this colander actually exceeded my expectations .. it seems to be of very high quality .. metal is thick compared to most other products out there today yet it's very light to handle .. it does a great job keeping even the small stuff in the colander .. if something does get stuck in the holes I have simply used a small brush that we keep at the sink to brush away anything that has gotten stuck .. would buy this product again in a heart beat ...
customer_reviews.author: shawn887

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Very well built in stainless steel with riveted handles and a stand with cutouts so draining water doesn't look at the bottom. Generous size can easily accommodate a large pot of pasta. The holes may be a little large for rinsing smaller uncooked grains but definitely works well for cooked grains.
customer_reviews.author: Homebody Gearhead

customer_reviews.title: Everything hubby was looking for
customer_reviews.text: "The Colander arrived well packaged and it was everything that my better half was looking for. Very easy to clean and holds a great amount. He was pleased."
customer_reviews.author: Deborah J. Penhale

customer_reviews.title: Still perfect after 9 months...
customer_reviews.text: So I bought another one. Really great strainer. Some reviewers say its tough to clean. It's probably because this thing passes liquid so well. But I wouldn't know, I use a dishwasher and have never had mine come out other than spotless.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Veter

customer_reviews.title: Good quality large colander
customer_reviews.text: I like almost everything about this stainless colander; large size, the handles and base seem to be attached well, and the base is large enough so that it’s very stable and not likely to tip when pouring in pasta or vegetables. My only complaint is that the underneath side is rough around the drain holes and will soon tear up any cleaning sponge. The underneath side should have been finished as smoothly as the top side.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Durable; good quality
customer_reviews.text: This colander is sturdy and durable. It has plenty of holes throughout. The edges of the holes aren't sharp -- which is great, because sharp holes would mess up my pasta and also be hard to clean. This colander handles all my pastas well and is easy to clean. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Carol G.

customer_reviews.title: Would make a great wedding gift
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my kitchen. Drains well, easy cleaning and will hang on the wall. Very nice size and quality would make a nice gift.
customer_reviews.author: Phyl's Folly

customer_reviews.title: Badabing!
customer_reviews.text: Da best of da best! You don't need no plastic strainer no mores. Alls you need is one metal one, and your good to go for the rest of your life. Badabing!
customer_reviews.author: John Malkovich

customer_reviews.title: LiveFresh Stainless Steel Micro-perforated 5-Quart Colander
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and in good condition. Only time will tell its durability and sturdiness. The outside has raised ridges surrounding the many hole stamped in the bowl, and may prove a cleaning problem. Will update soon.
customer_reviews.author: EDDY - Alsea, OR

customer_reviews.title: Very nice colander
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It has a really nice feel to it--good weight and balance; with hundreds of holes it drains almost immediately; the base ring has two big holes so it doesn't trap water (much--I think it could have at least two more drainage holes). Cons: Soft foods, like overdone pasta, can stick in those hundreds of holes and make for a real cleaning chore with toothbrush and toothpick. I think the pros outweigh the cons and would buy this again (although it feels solidly enough made I don't think it's going to break).
customer_reviews.author: Walter F.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and functional colander
customer_reviews.text: The perforated colander showed up on time and complied with the description noted on the Amazon Website and I would purchase it again if needed. The colander appears well made and should last a long time under normal household use. The non-reactive stainless steel is a plus and was the main reason for purchasing this new colander to replace an old aluminum colander we had for years.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: High quality, lightweight and functional.
customer_reviews.text: This has proven to be a high-quality colander. Lightweight and functional. Other stainless steel colander as I have used have had rough edges around the holes on one side or the other due to machining. This one is smooth on both sides and therefore easier to use and clean.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: I see that there are already plenty of good reviews but I feel the need to reiterate them. This colander is fantastic. It looks good in the kitchen, it drains easily, it's easy to clean, it's stainless steel so food safety is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kuoting Chiu

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used it yet but I know it'll be fine. I'm replacing a plastic colander I've had for ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be very well made and just what I wanted. I haven't used it yet but I know it'll be fine. I'm replacing a plastic colander I've had for over thirty years so you know I'm not hard on them. It just is short of capacity at times so I wanted to upgrade. This was the perfect replacement at a reasonable price. Now I just have to get up the nerve to toss the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim V.

customer_reviews.title: Large sturdy stainless steel colander
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used it to drain homemade yogurt. I lined it with white cotton fabric and it drained perfectly. I expect it will be great for draining pasta and draining freshly washed fruits and vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: sawandquilt

customer_reviews.title: Rough inside
customer_reviews.text: I will continue to use this colander, but miss my old one ( a different type) that I gave to my son. As an older person, I was happy to get an old fashioned colander. However, I do see that the holes inside are scratchy.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Salad bowl
customer_reviews.text: I call this strainer SALAD BOWL! I have used this thing for making salads and nothing else. It does a great job and it looks great. This strainer is well made and should last a long, long time. Buy one you will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy  Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great strainer
customer_reviews.text: got this for my wife to replace an old worn out broken plastic strainer she had for 15 yrs. She was skeptical about a metal strainer but I talked her into it. She now loves it and won't be with out it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D.

customer_reviews.title: This colander is great. It is very well made and sits level ...
customer_reviews.text: This colander is great. It is very well made and sits level on the base. The holes in the base are an absolutely great feature that allows the water to drain from all sides and not build up in the sink, so you can sit it wherever in the sink and it will drain without the water level raising and touching the contained items. The handles are very securely fastened to the bowel. The product has all smooth edges with no sharp items that would catch cheese cloth or other bits of cloth that sit in it. This is a great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Terrific strainer!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this strainer! It's a perfect size (large) for straining pasta or for using when washing large quantities of fruit or vegetables. I especially like that it's stainless--exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Goldie

customer_reviews.title: No more escaped spaghetti!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly whatvI needed to keep spaghetti contained while strained. No rust yet even when we didn't rinse & wash it immediately. Looks nice hanging on the pot rack too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: water gets down into the base of it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this now for a few months and there doesn't seem to be any problems other than when ever I use it or wash it I have to be careful that no water got down into the base when you use it just leave it sitting upside down for a while after
customer_reviews.author: Brittaney

customer_reviews.title: Riveted handles, drains fast
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd get this invested in a colander, but I am. I picked this one because I wanted something that would drain pasta fast enough so that the noodles wouldn't be awash in pasta water that was in contact with the sink drain. I also liked the riveted handles without silicone (it just falls apart after a while) and the fact that this one has feet. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small pieces are always getting stuck in the little holes
customer_reviews.text: Pieces of pasta or rice are always getting stuck in the little holes. Relatively difficult to clean them out. I’m going to give this to my local thrift store.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur J.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our venerable aged plastic collander with this thing and we couldn't be happier. A kitchen magician is only as good as his or her tools. This thing will last two lifetimes. Get it. You'll be thankin' me!
customer_reviews.author: Norman Morrison

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I tend to keep kitchen utensils forever. After I don't know how many years I finally had to discard an enameled steel colander that finally rusted through. So I thought why not try stainless steel. This, so far, is great. Big enough to drain a pound of pasta. Drains rapidly. The ring stand is high enough to keep the draining pasta is out of the water. This will be used almost every day, we'll see how it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly's Creek

customer_reviews.title: My last colander!
customer_reviews.text: I have several LiveFresh kitchen tools and am never disappointed. The handles on this one are large and easy to grab and the bowl is a generous size. I like the holes in the base that help drain liquids away from the food when the colander is standing in the sink. Am slowly replacing plastic kitchen tools as they age and this is a perfect addition. Pretty sure this will last a very long time and is a healthy alternative to plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Peg

customer_reviews.title: Quality product. Not sure how ‘micro mesh’ though.
customer_reviews.text: Nice colander for most needs. I expected a little finer ‘micro mesh’, so I’m not sure how things like rice or quinoa will work with this. I still use my mesh sieve for that. Good size and drains fast.
customer_reviews.author: NiceN

customer_reviews.title: Great Collander!!
customer_reviews.text: I had placed an order with another vendor-the product never arrived-so I found your unit online and placed an over-the item arrived 2 days later and I was really impressed with the presentation an quality-very happy-(as a side note the other unit never arrived and I just got a refund d-45 days later)- will gladly recommend your product and have put it on my go to list when I need a nice gift!!
customer_reviews.author: william james burns

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: In a house where we are embracing a world with less plastic - this strainer fits the bill perfectly. Overall size is great. The base is wide enough that it doesn't try to tip over in my sink like some others do. The hole size is perfect for all kinds of materials. Cleans easily.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This ss strainer is very sturdy and I like the way the handles feel. Cleans well and is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this colander! Drains quickly and completely. Very easy to clean and so sturdy I am confident it will last the rest of my life! Definitely worth buying and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: FLNative

customer_reviews.title: Love this colander.
customer_reviews.text: This colander is awesome. Drains really fast but very sturdy. Works as well as a wire colander/sieve, but much stronger. I like the rim at the bottom that allows it to stand in the sink while you drain. The handles are sturdy as well and riveted on rather than welded.. much better in my opinion. A very nice colander. Just what I was looking for. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L. Quinlan

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: This colander is similar and cheaper to an ATK recommended product. It's great and works just as well for a few buck less. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John Carter

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality! I expect to have this for many years. It's already had some heavy use over the last few weeks and it's held up well. The welds on the handle are substantial. My last colander lost a handle after many years of use. I expect many years of use from this one too!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi M.

customer_reviews.title: No worries! Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: You can always assume that when ordering on Amazon, you may be getting some cheap chinese made products but the extra thickness on this is amazing. It's durable, well built and has lasted awhile for me. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Chels

customer_reviews.title: TOO BIG FOR A STANDARD DOUBLE-SIDED SINK
customer_reviews.text: I'm really not happy with this purchase. I'm considering returning it. It's big, hard to manage, hard to wash and it's not fun to use. It does do what it's supposed to do but for me...using it is an unpleasant experience and I hate washing it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!!  Love the smaller holes and the fact that it is lightweight too.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the nicest strainer I have ever owned. It does not rust and spaghetti doesn’t get stuck in the holes. It’s a nice weight and perfect size and comes with a guarantee if you register online.
customer_reviews.author: amazonreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this Stainless Steel Strainer
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today and seems very durable! All stainless! Large overall size with sturdy base and flat handles give lots of options! The perforations are just the size we wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: LiveFresh Stainless Steel Micro-Perforated 5-Quart Colander - Professional Strainer with Heavy Duty Handles and Self-draining Solid Ring Base - Dishwasher Safe
feature_bullets: 🍓 MICRO-PERFORATED HOLES DRAIN FASTER AND PREVENT FALL-THROUGH – Extra close, small holes on every surface allow for super-fast drainage so you don’t have to tilt the bowl to get all of the water out. Our robust sieve holds onto your spaghetti noodles and cooked rice and stops small foods from falling through.
🥑 SAVE TIME CLEANING – 100% dishwasher safe and rust-proof, this 5 Quart colander has never been easier to clean. The smooth pierced metal is gentle on your dish cloths and hands.

🍅 INDESTRUCTABLE DESIGN WITH RIVETED HANDLES – Constructed of professional grade 18/10, 304 stainless steel and built to last a lifetime. Our steel will never deform or bend as it’s 20% thicker than other colanders. Our premium handles are riveted to the bowl and will never come off!

🍏 GUARANTEED FOR LIFE – Rest assured, we are so confident that you will love our product that we back it up with a 100% lifetime manufacturer’s warranty. If you are unhappy with your purchase for your reason, get your money back – no questions asked.

🥬 RAPID DRAINING RING BASE THAT WON’T TIP OVER – The sturdy solid ring base keeps the colander from tipping over so that you can fill it up without fear of dumping your food. Precision-cut drainage ports are added to the base to prevent backflow, now water will not get trapped in the base.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars3,239 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
